events.name: GDG - Android Sessions - #1 XING
events.description:
The goal of this event is to gather the Android community in Porto, helping everyone to get up to date and to know Android a little bit better. We'll share knowledge and experience about the Android ecosystem.

This is the #1 Android Session, and it will be hosted in collaboration with XING (https://www.xing.com/) and they'll share with us their experience.

‚Ä¢ So, what's the plan here?

18:30 - Welcome snacks!
18:50 - Language abuse & Unreadability - Yahya Bayramoƒülu, XING
19:25 - How to dagger 2.15 - Pedro Gl√≥ria
20:00 - That's all folks!

‚Ä¢ Should I bring anything?
There is no need to bring anything, but if you have something cool to show you can bring it and share it with us!

‚Ä¢ Important stuff!
If you are joining, please book it here. We have limited sitting.

Also
Join GDG Porto on Slack https://gdgporto.slack.com/ and check out the #dev-android channel! If you need an invite please ping us at [masked]

‚Ä¢ About the speakers

## Yahya Bayramoƒülu

Yahya Bayramoƒülu is a passionate Android Developer from Turkey and currently working at XING located in Hamburg/Germany. He has been developing for Android Platform since 2012, and he is constantly adapting himself to the platform changes and requirements and always following up the new cool things on industry.

https://github.com/yayaa
https://www.xing.com/profile/Yahya_BAYRAMOGLU
https://twitter.com/YahyaBayramoglu

## Pedro Gl√≥ria

Hello, I'm Pedro an Android developer. I love tech, games, series and dogs. I've been programming in android for over 3 years where I've been in companies like Maily, a message/drawing app for kids, Bliss where I've worked with some major Portuguese companies and now at Farfetch. During my earlier programming days I've started with frontend where I've learned AngularJs, but Android is my passion. My life motto is Programmer at day. Progamer at night !

https://www.linkedin.com/in/pedro-gl%C3%B3ria-b269a871/
https://github.com/Peddro

events.name: GDG - Android Sessions - #2 Blip
events.description:
The goal of this event is to gather the Android community in Porto, helping everyone to get up to date and to know Android a little bit better. We'll share knowledge and experience about the Android ecosystem.

This is the #2 Android Session, and it will be hosted in collaboration with Blip (https://www.blip.pt/) and they'll share with us their experience.

‚Ä¢ So, what's the plan here?

18:30 - Welcome snacks!
18:50 - The Droid on Webs - Jo√£o Z√£o, Blip
19:25 - Building a Database with Room, Rui Mendes
20:00 - That's all folks!

‚Ä¢ Should I bring anything?
There is no need to bring anything, but if you have something cool to show you can bring it and share it with us!

‚Ä¢ Important stuff!
If you are joining, please book it here. We have limited sitting.

Also
Join GDG Porto on Slack https://gdgporto.slack.com/ and check out the #dev-android channel! If you need an invite please ping us at [masked]

‚Ä¢ About the speakers

## Jo√£o Z√£o

Hey, I‚Äôm Jo√£o Z√£o a devoted Android Developer, an Electrical and Computer Engineer with great enthusiasm in Computer Science. Creative thinker, passionate about generating ideas and bringing them to life.
My very first contact with Android was in 2011 but it only started to make part of my professional life around 2014. During that time I developed several apps in the most different areas, going from entertainment to corporate apps (IoT, mobile games, cloud). Currently I continue my relationship with the green robot at Blip, where I started to focus more on Architecture and SOLID design principles.

https://github.com/Binglas
https://www.linkedin.com/in/joaozao/
https://twitter.com/JoaoBZao

Talk abstract

WebView exists since the beginning of Android but its usage has been changing ever since. In this talk we will travel through the huge changes that this versatile component of the Android SDK has suffered during the times. We will also see how it is to setup a basic implementation of a well working WebView and compare the most common usages whilst pointing the pros/cons and also some curious challenges.

## Rui Mendes

Senior Android Developer @ Wetek.
Roughly 5 years working with the Android platform.
Most of his time is spent between beer, sports (mainly watching sports, not really practicing!) and a computer, with no particular order.
Tries to be funny sometimes, but usually without great success.

https://github.com/ruimendesM
https://www.linkedin.com/in/rui-mendes-2482465b/

Talk abstract

Room Persistent Library is one of the most exciting libraries for you to build a Database. It is annotation based and provides an abstraction layer over the SQLite, thus reducing the boiler plate code. This presentation targets developers with no or limited experience with the Room Persistent Library, since the idea is to give an overview over the library features and what can be achieved with it.

events.name: GDG - Android Sessions - #3 WIT-Software
events.description:
The goal of this event is to gather the Android community in Porto, helping everyone to get up to date and to know Android a little bit better. We'll share knowledge and experience about the Android ecosystem.

This is the #3 Android Session, it will be hosted in collaboration with WIT-Software (https://www.wit-software.com) and they'll share with us their experience.

‚Ä¢ So, what's the plan here?

18:30 - Welcome snacks!
18:50 - Securing Android Applications - Ant√≥nio Mendes, WIT-Software
19:25 - Clean Architecture + DI + Kotlin - Nelson Sachse
20:00 - That's all folks!

‚Ä¢ Should I bring anything?
There is no need to bring anything, but if you have something cool to show you can bring it and share it with us!

‚Ä¢ Important stuff!
If you are joining, please book it here. We have limited sitting.

Also
Join GDG Porto on Slack https://gdgporto.slack.com/ and check out the #dev-android channel! If you need an invite please ping us at [masked]

‚Ä¢ About the speakers

## Ant√≥nio Mendes

Ant√≥nio Mendes is an Information Security Enthusiast which loves all the security matters. He tries to keep up to date in security to be a step ahead of bad guys. Working mostly on application security with focus on mobile applications.

Talk abstract

Nowadays there are more than two billion Android devices around the world. We put all our information on those devices and it becomes the main target for malicious people. The question is, are we safe? What we can do, as developers, to increase security of our applications?
During this presentation we will show hints to make our applications safer and protect the privacy of the end user.

## Nelson Sachse

With 10 years experience in the tech industry Nelson Sachse is a London based mobile consultant with a passion for edTech and working for clients as Sony, Universal, JLR, Whitbread, Nissan among other.

https://twitter.com/SachseInTheCity
https://nelsonsachse.com/

Talk abstract

A breakdown into the clean architecture pattern using dependency injection and sprinkled with Kotlin sugar.

events.name: GDG - Android Sessions - #5 Mindera
events.description:
We want to gather the Android community in Porto, helping everyone to get up to date and to know Android a little bit better. We'll share knowledge and experience about the Android ecosystem.

This session will be hosted by Mindera. They'll share with us their space, cookies and experience. Check them out (https://mindera.com)!

‚Ä¢ So, what's the plan here?

17:30 - Welcome snacks!
18:00 - Iveta Jurcikova - MVI on Android
18:35 - Gilson - ReactNative
19:10 - Santiago Vanegas - Combining Observables in Rx
20:00 - That's all folks!

‚Ä¢ Should I bring anything?
There is no need to bring anything, but if you have something cool to show you can bring it and share it with us!

‚Ä¢ Important stuff!
If you are joining, please book it here. We have limited sitting.

‚Ä¢ Who are the speakers?

Iveta Jurcikova (STRV) - https://www.linkedin.com/in/iveta-jurcikova-728ab2145/

*MVI on Android*

"Every Android developer has heard about MVP and MVVM patterns. Even without so much effort, we can explain what is the meaning of the ‚ÄúV‚Äù, ‚ÄúP‚Äù and ‚ÄúVM‚Äù in this acronyms. However, have you ever thought about what is the purpose of the ‚ÄúM‚Äù which stands for ‚ÄúModel‚Äù? Are we still following its original definition or have we just misused it to describe those patterns?
In this talk, I am going to introduce you a reactive architecture for Android which uses the model according to its original interpretation. Do you know how this story will end? And what if coroutines step into the game‚Ä¶?"

Gilson (HOLD) - https://www.linkedin.com/in/gilson-marquato-jr/

*ReactNative*

"React Native is a framework made by Facebook to let us build a real native app using JS and React. You can write native code too, without slowing down the app.
You will be able to see what can be created with React Native and might be surprised by its performance!"

Santiago Gil (STRV) - https://www.linkedin.com/in/svanegas/

*Combining Observables in Rx*

"Several times we face up with situations where we need to handle more than one source of data, processing them by performing calculations or just pairing them together.
ReactiveX has powerful operators that allow us to do so, even for very specific scenarios.
Let‚Äôs see an explanation about some of those operators, we will go through practical examples which are pretty easy to understand and to get key differences between them."

Also
Join GDG Porto on Slack (https://gdgporto.slack.com/) and check out the #dev-android channel!
Invitation link: https://join.slack.com/t/gdgporto/shared_invite/enQtMzkwNjg1MTQxNzAxLWQ1NDEyNmZhOTNiNjViNTU4M2E0NGI2NDBiY2YzNjUxZjIyZDJhZGE2Y2FkMmQxYzk0NDYyNWViZjA5MzdkNWE

If you need to reach GDG Porto, please ping us at [masked]

events.description:
It‚Äôs on! GDG DevFest is back in Porto and you are invited to join us!

Tickets here: https://bit.ly/2D4waVW

Haven't heard of it? So what is a DevFest?
DevFests are community-led, developer events hosted by GDG chapters around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google‚Äôs technologies. Each DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community and region that hosts it.

So in Porto?
We are building a friendly and inclusive environment for everyone, so if you are a developer, student, designer or an enthusiast, you are qualified to come.

We'll have Android, Cloud, Web, Design and much more.

You‚Äôll have the chance to meet amazing players of the tech industry, get to know our great community and learn something new. Also, if you are not from Porto, you‚Äôll get to know this fantastic city.

We have a mind blowing day prepared for you, so what are you waiting for?

More info: https://devfest.gdgporto.xyz/

events.name: A byte of: Angular
events.description:
Byte sized meetups, to open your appetite.

In this byte, we‚Äôll talk about web, more specifically Angular. Sani Yusuf and Andrew Wiens are in town and want to meet you all!

# The Schedule

18:00 - Doors open, we greet you!
18:30 - Andrew Wiens - Drag and Drop Isn't a Drag with Angular Material CDK
19:00 - Sani Yusuf - Let's Build A Form Around it
19:30 - Q&A with a beer in hand
20:00 - You leave, doors close (sad_face.gif)

# The speakers

## Sani Yusuf
Google Developer Expert For Web, Founder Of Haibrid

Talk abstract:
"Reactive Forms are a mainstay in the Angular ecosystem yet a lot of developers limit their usage to just Login pages or traditional input collection. In this talk, I will showcase how you can take advantage of the full power of Reactive Forms to build some really powerful state-driven solutions. This talked will be based on a real-world personal experience of building complex data-driven healthcare solutions with Reactive Forms. I will also showcase some really common use cases in a Lot of angular applications that may not be obvious for the application of Reactive Forms. We will explore the hierarchy of Reactive Form Controls and showcase some smart ways to implement custom validation inside of your Angular application. The main aim of this talk is to enable users to be aware of what is at their disposal and how they can take advantage of the full power of Reactive Forms."

More info:
https://developers.google.com/experts/people/sani-yusuf
https://www.linkedin.com/in/saniyusuf/
https://medium.com/@saniyusuf
https://github.com/saniyusuf
https://twitter.com/saniyusuf
https://saniyusuf.com/

## Andrew Wiens
Software developer at Oasis Digital, Angular Boot Camp instructor, and CS PhD student at Cornell University

Talk abstract:
"From uploading files in Dropbox to sorting boards in Trello, drag-and-drop is an increasingly universal part of modern UIs. Despite this, implementing such features in an Angular application has not typically been straightforward. Adding drag-and-drop generally required either handling HTML5 events manually or relying on independent packages that may or may not play nicely with one‚Äôs component library of choice. What a drag!
Luckily, such pain is now a thing of the past. A highly-anticipated drag-and-drop feature with first-party support was recently added to the Angular Material CDK. Like the rest of the CDK, the drag-and-drop API does not require adoption of Angular Material itself. Rather, it provides UI behavior without enforcing the look-and-feel of the application ‚Äì the drag-and-drop feature can be readily used in any Angular application alongside other component libraries and styles.
The Angular Material CDK provides drag-and-drop capability in the form of easy-to-use components and directives. At its core, the drag-and-drop API allows the user to drag template elements anywhere in the window or between designated drop-sites. Additionally, the drag-and-drop library provides a variety of inputs and events to allow implementing more advanced, custom functionality if needed. In this talk we will explore the features of Angular Material CDK drag-and-drop and build a sample app using its API."

More info:
https://github.com/adwiens
https://twitter.com/adwiens

Join us on Slack: https://bit.ly/2S8lTky
You can also reach us at [masked]

events.name: A byte of: Streaming
events.description:
Byte sized meetups, to open your appetite.

In this byte, we‚Äôll talk about web, more specifically Video Streaming. Doug Sillars is in town and wants to meet you all!

# The Schedule

18:00 - Doors open
18:30 - Doug Sillars - I Stream, you Stream, how To make your Video Stream
19:10 - Q&A and networking

# The speaker

## Doug Sillars
Google Developer Expert for Web Technologies, Freelance Developer Evangelist for Mobile and web performance

Talk abstract:
"The use of video on the web and on mobile is growing. It is as easy as adding a < video src=‚Äùvideo.mp4‚Äù >, and you‚Äôre good to go. But, all the top video sites (YouTube, Netflix, Hulu) all stream their video. What do they know that we don‚Äôt know? Is streaming more efficient? Do I need any special equipment to create or serve video streams?
In this talk, we‚Äôll learn the how to create and stream videos, weigh the pros and cons of streaming vs. static videos, and see how easy it is to get started delivering streaming content on the web or to a mobile app.
In this talk, we‚Äôll look at the performance aspects of delivering video on the web, and how to improve the performance of video by using streaming instead of static videos."

More info:
https://twitter.com/dougsillars
https://dougsillars.com

Join us on Slack: https://bit.ly/2S8lTky
You can also reach us at [masked]

events.name: A byte of: Google Play
events.description:
Byte sized meetups, to open your appetite.

In this byte, we‚Äôll talk about app listing with Google Play. Macy Kuang is in town and wants to meet you all!

# The Schedule

18:00 - Doors open
18:30 - Macy Kuang - How to improve the app listing with Google Play
19:10 - Q&A and networking

# The speaker

## Macy Kuang
Macy Kuang is not just the producer and host of her own YouTube technology tips and tricks show - CodeToCreate (https://www.youtube.com/CodeToCreate), she is also the founder of Miaomiao Games (http://miaomiaogames.com/). She is on the organizing committee for AndroidTO (http://androidto.com/), the annual Android conference, and the co-organizer of the Toronto Google Developer Group (https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Toronto/). Macy became a Google Developer Expert for Wearable since 2014 and is now an IoT Pioneer. In 2016, Macy became the Intel innovator for IoT and Game Development.

Talk abstract:
"As a software developer we love to make apps but often we spend very little time on the actual store front of our product.
In this talk, I will talk about the essential features that will help us market our apps better and keep our users engaged with real examples.
We will talk about AB Testing, custom store listings and tips from top Apps on the Google Play store."

More info:
https://google-developers.appspot.com/community/experts/directory/profile/profile-macy_kuang

Join us on Slack: https://bit.ly/2S8lTky
You can also reach us at [masked]

events.name: Flutter Study Jam with Flutter Portugal
events.description:
This study jam joins GDG Porto, Flutter Portugal and NEI-ISEP, in a full day event.

‚ö†Ô∏è Important: This is a limited seat event, so RSVP responsibly

# What is Flutter?
Flutter is Google‚Äôs portable UI kit for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

# Want to get started on building Flutter apps?
Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! You will learn about the fundamentals and, by the end of the day, you will leave with an app that you build!

# Who should attend?
1) Those just getting started with mobile app development
2) Those with programming experience on other mobile app frameworks
3) Everyone interested!

# What is the plan?

9:00 - Intro to Flutter
13:00 - Lunch break
14:00 - Let's build an app
18:00 - Study Jam ends

# Required materials
Laptop with Flutter (https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install) and VS Code (https://code.visualstudio.com/) installed.
Also, don't forget your charger!

# Who are the trainers?

Filipe Barroso and Renan are the beautiful minds behind this study jam. They are both part of Flutter Portugal, and they can't wait to start this!

## Filipe Barroso - https://twitter.com/abarroso

Not your usual software developer, he loves getting out of the zone of comfort and if you don't see him at a tech event, he is probably organizing the next tech event for Google Developer Group Lisbon, that he is an organizer for the last last 3 years, where he organized more than 60 events, 4 of them being full-day conferences. He is always reading about psychology or supporting a local community to grow. He has a strong opinion about social impact, inclusivity and the importance of communities. Lately, he has been advocating the new Flutter SDK by Google, around Portugal, by organizing Flutter Talks and workshops.

As a developer, he has worked in android applications for companies such as Altice, Brisa, Federa√ß√£o Portuguesa Futebol, TAP, Bayer among many others and currently is working remotely as an Android Developer and Machine Learning Engineer.

## Renan Ara√∫jo - https://caraujo.me/

Solving problems (sometimes with code) since longer than I would like do admit. Loving to use math and logic to create beautiful user interfaces. Started my career as a web developer and in love with CSS since the very first day. After meeting Flutter, realized that easy and flexible interface code can be written everywhere. Flutter and flame contributor and open source maintainer (photo_view), I¬¥ve been into flutter since alpha.

events.name: A byte of: Flutter
events.description:
Byte sized meetups, to open your appetite.

In this byte, we‚Äôll talk about Flutter. Jairzinno Henriquez is in town and wants to meet you all!

# The Schedule

18:00 - Doors open
18:30 - Jairzinno Henriquez - Adding a fourth layer to the test pyramid
19:10 - Q&A and networking

# The speaker

## Jairzinno Henriquez
Jairzinno is a Software Engineer with an experience building Android and iOS apps for projects in finance, education, energy and for the Dutch government. In his spare time Jairzinno organizes GDG meetups and likes to cycle.

Talk abstract:
"Flutter allows you to build mobile apps fast. With the tools provided to you, it's also possible to build robust mobile apps.
Just by following the traditional test pyramid you're already set to deliver great apps. But Flutter makes it possible to test separate widgets. This adds a different dimension to testing your apps.
During this session we'll cover a simple app and test it covering the traditional test pyramid and show how testing your widgets makes your apps even more robust."

Join us on Slack: https://bit.ly/2S8lTky
You can also reach us at [masked]

events.name: DevFest planning
events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
We will reboot the organising team of GDG Porto, and prepare this year's DevFest!
events.how_to_find_us: Top floor, we'll have GDG clothes

events.name: Android Sessions 2020 - #1 AddCode
events.description:
We want to gather the Android community in Porto, helping everyone to get up to date and to know Android a little bit better. We'll share knowledge and experience about the Android ecosystem.

This session will be hosted by AddCode. They'll share with us their space, cookies and experience. Check them out (https://addcode.io/)!

‚Ä¢ So, what's the plan here?

18:30 - Welcome snacks!
19:00 - Filipe Baptista - Kotlin: More Than Meets the Eye
19:30 - Orazio Cotroneo - Think in modules
20:00 - That's all folks!

‚Ä¢ Should I bring anything?
There is no need to bring anything, but if you have something cool to show you can bring it and share it with us!

‚Ä¢ Important stuff!
If you are joining, please book it here. We have limited sitting.

‚Ä¢ Who are the speakers?

# Filipe Baptista - Android Developer

"Hello üëã
I'm Filipe Baptista, an Android Developer, and I have been playing with the green robot guy since 2011.
Always eager to learn and improve, when I'm not coding I like to spend my time traveling, listening to music and having a good cup of coffee, if possible the three combined."

## Talk abstract

There is no doubt that Kotlin is here to stay for a long time, it is a modern programming language with a lot of modern features. In this talk I will try to show some ‚Äòhidden‚Äô gems of Kotlin such as: reified, delegates or operator overloading.

## More about Filipe

https://twitter.com/filipebatista
https://www.linkedin.com/in/filipebatista
https://github.com/filipebatista

# Orazio Cotroneo - Engineering Team Lead at Trainline

Orazio is a software engineer with experience in IT and ICT that specialises in Web-Oriented and Service-Oriented Software Development, Database, Object-Oriented Software Development.

## Talk abstract

A planned journey from a monolithic to a more robust, maintainable and scalable application architecture

## More about Orazio

https://www.linkedin.com/in/orazio-cotroneo-a5936012/

Also
Join GDG Porto on Slack (https://gdgporto.slack.com/) and check out the #dev-android channel!

If you need to reach GDG Porto, please ping us at [masked]
